title: in-game freezing
body:
I just reinstalled league of legends

I had problems when i tried to install the game i had an error msg that i forgot to screenshoot, then i followed the tip" to delete the client exe and i managed to install it and upgrade it to the new client

I played a ladder game and  i started to have a lot of packet loss, i would freeze every few seconds for long periods of time even for a minute or 20 seconds then everything would speed up again, sometimes i couldnt even see jungle mobs, sometimes my chat would work but screen would not move , all sort of errors..
i was monitoring "speed, and ping test" in game and outside the game and my connection was perfect, i don't have any trouble playing any other games
pd: sorry for my poor english

replies.body: i did everything in the connection issues list before posting here , cmd commands flush dns ,ipconfig etc, computer reset , reinstalled the game twice , hextech fix twice , restarted my modem 3 times , unplugged my ethernet , i disactivated my antivirus , and  as i said i did not make any change in my ports , modem , or computer this happened out of nowhere

i did the log check before posting here , and it said i lost a lot of package , but i have no idea how to fix it , i reinstalled the game and the problem still the same Your average percentage of packet loss for this game was 28.17%. when i try the Hextech Repair Tool i get this - This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below. AccessDenied Access Denied CCE6C0B0C9DBF746 JsjZzEohsqP9MXAMSVk1dzPm+qkMI47uf5E4XomKWOidLN1ZylyMYf4/omWd2tpu4G1ee0LohD0= i played league without any problem until now , no router changes or anything the freezing increases as the game goes on, i can see the chat and even type most of the time while freezed , but hotkeys or mouse wont have any effect while this happens i have no problem or my roomate playing any other games works perfectly , as well as websites

Thanks for the info!  That packet loss is pretty substantial, but there are some steps that can be taken to fix it up.  Go through each instruction found in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to configure your network and fix up any instability.  Test it out in a custom game to prevent any penalties.  Keep in mind that despite having great internet, you can still have issues reaching specific servers.  That should do the trick!

It sounds like you're having some serious connection issues to the game servers, so a reinstall wouldn't really fix this.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to get an overview and know for sure!

Should my suspicions confirm a problem with your network, then I suggest using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to troubleshoot.  Let me know if you have any questions!
